summary: This bill, known as the "Agent Raul Gonzalez Officer Safety Act," creates a new federal crime for intentionally fleeing a U.S. Border Patrol agent or other assisting law enforcement officer in a motor vehicle within 100 miles of the U.S. border. Penalties range from up to two years in prison to a life sentence if a death results. The bill also makes individuals who commit this offense inadmissible to the U.S., deportable, and ineligible for immigration relief, including asylum. It mandates an annual report on statistics related to this new offense.
